resources.string: Hide your location from websites and conceal your online activity from Internet providers and others on your network.

resources.string: DuckDuckGo Network Protection is currently in beta. Share feedback to help us improve!
"Network Protection is enabled and routing traffic through the VPN."
Network Protection interrupted. Attempting to reconnect now…
Network Protection failed to connect. Please try again later.
Network Protection is ON. Your location and online activity are protected.
Connection interrupted. Attempting to reconnect now…
Failed to connect. Please try again later.
Your VPN app may be disconnected
Android only allows one active VPN connection at a time. Enabling Network Protection may disconnect any active VPN on your device.
Your VPN app is blocking Network Protection
Android only allows one active VPN connection at a time. Open Network settings > VPN. Find the VPN app that’s “always-on” and disable it to continue.
Go to your device’s VPN Settings for DuckDuckGo and enable Always-on VPN to prevent Android disabling protection.\n\nMake sure to leave the other setting OFF.
To avoid app issues, go to your device\'s VPN Settings for DuckDuckGo and disable Block connections without VPN.
Network Protection is disabled.\nA VPN app on your device may have disabled it. Use the toggle to re-enable.
Action required! To avoid app issues, you need to change your Android settings. Change settings
You\'re invited to test a beta feature!
Error joining the Waitlist, please try again later
DuckDuckGo Network Protection is currently in closed, invite-only beta.
DuckDuckGo will never log, track, or share your network data.
We\'ll send you a notification when Network Protection is ready for you.
Your invite to try Network Protection will arrive here. Check back soon, or we can send you a notification when it\'s your turn.
Get a notification when Network Protection is ready for you.
Enter your invite code below to continue.
We didn\'t recognise this Invite Code.
Error redeeming code, please try again later
You\'ll need an invite code to fully unlock this feature.
Network Protection works across all apps by default. If you’re experiencing app issues with Network Protection enabled, try disabling protection for that app.
App issues may occur if enabled

string.instruction: Placeholder is the name of an app

resources.string: Please let us know if you disabled Network Protection for %1$s because you experienced app issues.\n\nWe\'ll also disable App Tracking Protection for %1$s.
Report an Issue With an App
This will update your custom protection settings and enable Network Protection for all apps. You can always change your protection settings again later.
Enabling protection sends the app\'s name to DuckDuckGo.

A virtual private network, commonly known as a VPN, is a tool that protects your privacy and anonymity while online. It hides your real IP address so that websites cannot identify you or your location with it. It also encrypts your online data so that others sharing your network cannot see the links you click, the files you download, or the messages you send.\n\nA VPN is especially important when connecting to public Wi-Fi at coffee shops and airports where you could be exposing your private information and browsing habits to others on that network. A VPN should also be considered for use at home where it can hide your browsing history from your internet service provider who may log and sell that information to other third parties.

A VPN creates a "tunnel" between your device and a remote server in another location operated by the VPN provider. All of your online activity is then routed through that tunnel so that it exits from the remote server using a different IP address from yours. Along the way, all of your data is also encrypted (or scrambled) so that others cannot read it.\n\nThere can be some drawbacks to using a VPN. You may experience slower internet speeds depending on how far way the remote server so it\'s recommended to use the nearest server when possible. You may also experience issues accessing or loading certain websites or applications as some developers intentionally block VPN traffic.

Network Protection uses the WireGuard protocol to configure a virtual private network (VPN) on your device. When enabled, all of your device traffic is first encrypted and then routed through the nearest DuckDuckGo server to hide your browsing activity from your internet service provider and your location from the sites you visit.
Is all of my traffic protected or just web surfing?
All of your device traffic is protected.
Does DuckDuckGo keep logs of my data?
No, we do not store activity logs of any kind.
Where are Network Protection servers located?
DuckDuckGo offers a limited number of servers today in the United States, Canada, and Europe while it is in beta.
Why can\'t I choose my server?
Network Protection automatically selects the nearest server to you to ensure your browsing speeds remain as high as possible while connected.
Does DuckDuckGo limit my speed or bandwidth?
No, we do not throttle your connection speeds or bandwidth. You may however naturally experience a decrease in your speeds based on your proximity to the nearest server.
Why do some apps not work when Network Protection is on?

Some app or website developers intentionally block VPN traffic or they may require you to complete a captcha first to prove you\'re a real person. If you consistently experience issues with an app, you can exclude it from the VPN altogether under Network Protection settings.
Why can\'t I dismiss the Network Protection notifications?
Android devices require that we display a permanent notification while the VPN is enabled.
Is Network Protection compatible with App Tracking Protection?
Yes, both Network Protection and App Tracking Protection can be enabled at the same time. No other VPN is compatible with App Tracking Protection.
Is Network Protection free to use?
Network Protection is free to use during the beta.
